item.title: Alert

Your application was approved.&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-buttongroup &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-button text=&#34;Hide&#34; type=&#34;primary&#34; onclick=&#34;this.closest(&#39;.card&#39;).querySelector(&#39;.alert&#39;).hidden=true&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-button text=&#34;Show&#34; onclick=&#34;this.closest(&#39;.card&#39;).querySelector(&#39;.alert&#39;).hidden=false&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-buttongroup &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-card &gt;}} Card Title Congratulations! Your application was approved. item.title: Blockquote
item.description: With source: {{< blockquote cite="Mark Twain" text="The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become." />}} The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become. Mark Twain With anonymous source: {{< blockquote text="Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated." />}} Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated. N.N. With source and citation link:
item.content:encoded: With source: {{&lt; blockquote cite=&#34;Mark Twain&#34; text=&#34;The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become.&#34; /&gt;}} The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become. Mark Twain With anonymous source: {{&lt; blockquote text=&#34;Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated.&#34; /&gt;}} Obsessed is a word that the lazy use to describe the dedicated. N.N. With source and citation link: {{&lt; blockquote citelink=&#34;https://style.mla.org/urls-some-practical-advice/&#34; cite=&#34;Angela Gibson, URLs: Some Practical Advice&#34; text=&#34;Ensuring the enduring availability and retrievability of a source is not the primary objective of documentation, even though the Internet allows for the retrieval of online works referred to in other online works.&#34; /&gt;}} Ensuring the enduring availability and retrievability of a source is not the primary objective of documentation, even though the Internet allows for the retrieval of online works referred to in other online works. Angela Gibson, URLs: Some Practical Advice With citation link but no source: {{&lt; blockquote citelink=&#34;https://bitly.is/2mkxskj&#34; text=&#34;When you create your own Branded Short Domain, you can expect to see up to a 34% increase in CTR when compared to standard bit.ly links.&#34; /&gt;}} When you create your own Branded Short Domain, you can expect to see up to a 34% increase in CTR when compared to standard bit.ly links. bitly.is/2mkxskj With longer quotations: {{&lt; blockquote cite=&#34;Erin Cummings&#34; &gt;}} At the end of the day, you are solely responsible for your success and your failure. And the sooner you realize that, you accept that, and integrate that into your work ethic, you will start being successful. As long as you blame others for the reason you aren&#39;t where you want to be, you will always be a failure. {{&lt; /blockquote &gt;}} At the end of the day, you are solely responsible for your success and your failure. And the sooner you realize that, you accept that, and integrate that into your work ethic, you will start being successful. As long as you blame others for the reason you aren&#39;t where you want to be, you will always be a failure. Erin Cummings

item.title: Code Analysis
item.description: After Dark includes a source build of htmltest which may be used to analyze HTML generated for problems such as linkrot, meta attributes and more. Code analysis is ideal for identifying potential 404 errors and determining when to link to the archived version of an external page which has gone offline. To use install Docker then run the following command: cd after-dark/docker/htmltest && docker build --rm . Build container uses Alpine and includes musl-dev for high-performance.
item.content:encoded: After Dark includes a source build of htmltest which may be used to analyze HTML generated for problems such as linkrot, meta attributes and more. Code analysis is ideal for identifying potential 404 errors and determining when to link to the archived version of an external page which has gone offline. To use install Docker then run the following command: cd after-dark/docker/htmltest &amp;&amp; docker build --rm . Build container uses Alpine and includes musl-dev for high-performance. Update the HTMLTEST_VERSION to get a specific release built. Upon successful build extract the resulting binary out of the scratch container like: docker create -it --name temp f2b785583ce8 sh &amp;&amp; \ sudo docker cp temp:/htmltest /usr/local/bin &amp;&amp; \ docker rm -fv temp Where f2b785583ce8 is the scratch container’s Image ID and /usr/local/bin is the destination on the host. Place executable in most appropriate directory. If using Hugo 0.56.x or higher may also possible to include htmltest as a Go module using Hugo Modules if your particular use case calls for it. See htmltest for documentation and usage.

item.title: Code Highlighter

{{ .body }} &lt;/div&gt; ``` Resulting in the following highlighted code: &lt;div class=&#34;alert {{with.type}}alert-{{.}}{{end}}&#34;&gt; {{.body}} &lt;/div&gt; Or use the highlight shortcode provided by Hugo: {{&lt; highlight python &gt;}} @app.on_message(Filters.private) def hello(client, message): message.reply_text(&#34;Hello {}&#34;.format(message.from_user.first_name)) {{&lt; /highlight &gt;}} To add line numbers and highlighting: 5@app.on_message(Filters.private) 6def hello(client, message): 7 message.reply_text(&#34;Hello {}&#34;.format(message.from_user.first_name)) Not feeling the colors? No problem. Use the hugo gen chromastyles command to generate your own syntax.css stylesheet from the style gallery and customize it using the general-purpose Atom One Chroma syntax theme-roller. And if you&rsquo;re really enterprising why not create some executable ASCII art representing the name of the game you implemented in the language used: Linus Akesson presents: The Game Of Life implemented in Brainfuck for instance &#34;fg&#34; to toggle the cell at row f and column g Hit enter to calculate the next generation Type q to quit That really is Brainfuck.

item.title: Error Page
item.description: After Dark includes an animated 404 Page you can display when other pages cannot be found. The error page contains a full-screen background animation and “404” link with Ginsu treatment. Following the link navigates to the homepage. Interactive Example
item.content:encoded: After Dark includes an animated 404 Page you can display when other pages cannot be found. The error page contains a full-screen background animation and &ldquo;404&rdquo; link with Ginsu treatment. Following the link navigates to the homepage. Interactive Example Adjust it from 404.html in the site content directory: ├── archetypes ├── content │ ├── post │ └── 404.html ├── layouts If the file doesn&rsquo;t exist yet, copy it from the theme default: $ cp themes/after-dark/content/404.html content Configure your web server to redirect to 404.html when pages cannot be found to use it. Combine with Voyeur Module for help creating Page Aliases.

item.title: Fetch Injection
item.description: After Dark uses the Fetch Inject library to load and execute external scripts and styles faster than browsers are capable of otherwise. Fetch Injection was conceptualized and developed for After Dark to make it possible to deep-link to full-sized Image Gallery images without blocking page load and has other performance applications: Use Case Chrome Performance Comparison (4G simulated connection speed) Without Fetch Inject With Fetch Inject WordPress Twenty Seventeen ~3.
item.content:encoded: After Dark uses the Fetch Inject library to load and execute external scripts and styles faster than browsers are capable of otherwise. Fetch Injection was conceptualized and developed for After Dark to make it possible to deep-link to full-sized Image Gallery images without blocking page load and has other performance applications: Use Case Chrome Performance Comparison (4G simulated connection speed) Without Fetch Inject With Fetch Inject WordPress Twenty Seventeen ~3.600s ~0.918s Use Fetch Inject in your Custom Layouts to load scripts and styles cross-origin or from your site static directory. Given the following static folder contents: ├── layouts ├── static │ ├── js │ │ ├── jquery.slim.min.js │ │ ├── tether.min.js │ │ └── bootstrap.min.js │ └── css │ └── font-awesome.min.css └── themes You can load Bootstrap (w/Font Awesome) and show how long ago it finished: 1&lt;script&gt; 2 fetchInject([ 3 &#39;https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/lodash/latest/lodash.min.js&#39;, 4 &#39;https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/momentjs/latest/moment.min.js&#39; 5 ]) 6 .then(() =&gt; { 7 const start = moment(); 8 fetchInject([&#39;/js/bootstrap.min.js&#39;], 9 fetchInject([ 10 &#39;/js/jquery.slim.min.js&#39;, 11 &#39;/js/tether.min.js&#39;, 12 &#39;/css/font-awesome.min.css&#39; 13 ]) 14 ).then(console.log(`Bootstrap Loaded: ${_.capitalize(start.toNow())}.`)); 15 }); 16&lt;/script&gt; Fetch Inject is 555 bytes compressed, non-blocking and included by default in Custom Layouts. Visit the CodePen Playground to try it out.

item.content:encoded: With auto-focused Text Input requesting a new email address: {{&lt; hackcss-form autocomplete=&#34;disabled&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput autofocus=&#34;true&#34; type=&#34;email&#34; placeholder=&#34;Please change your email…&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-form &gt;}} With Text Input and Label inside Form Group running Fuzzy Search in new window: {{&lt; hackcss-form id=&#34;search&#34; action=&#34;/search/&#34; target=&#34;_blank&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-label for=&#34;query&#34; text=&#34;Search query:&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput id=&#34;query&#34; type=&#34;search&#34; name=&#34;s&#34; form=&#34;search&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} Search query: Two forms with a Button and Text Input inside Alert with Throbber: {{&lt; hackcss-alert type=&#34;info&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-form id=&#34;throttle&#34; method=&#34;post&#34; action=&#34;/throttle&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-form id=&#34;choke&#34; novalidate=&#34;true&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-button type=&#34;primary&#34; form=&#34;choke&#34; text=&#34;Doh!&#34; disabled=&#34;true&#34; /&gt;}} This one doesn&#39;t actually do anything… {{&lt; hackcss-throbber &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput type=&#34;hidden&#34; name=&#34;speed&#34; value=&#34;80&#34; form=&#34;throttle&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-alert &gt;}} Doh! This one doesn't actually do anything… With Form Group, Label, required and validated Text Input and Help Block: {{&lt; hackcss-form name=&#34;validate&#34; action=&#34;/validate&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-formgroup name=&#34;integrity&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-label for=&#34;digest&#34; &gt;}} &lt;abbr title=&#34;Secure Hash Algorithm&#34;&gt;SHA-512&lt;/abbr&gt; Digest: {{&lt; /hackcss-label &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput required=&#34;true&#34; autofocus=&#34;true&#34; autocomplete=&#34;off&#34; type=&#34;text&#34; id=&#34;digest&#34; name=&#34;digest&#34; pattern=&#34;^(?:[A-Za-z0-9+/]{4})*(?:[A-Za-z0-9+/]{2}==|[A-Za-z0-9+/]{3}=)?$&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-helpblock &gt;}} Submit with digest to validate installation. &lt;noscript&gt;JavaScript must be enabled for proper validation.&lt;/noscript&gt; {{&lt; /hackcss-helpblock &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-form &gt;}} SHA-512 Digest: Submit with digest to validate installation. JavaScript must be enabled for proper validation.

item.title: JIT Requests
item.description: After Dark makes JIT requests for some external assets to cut down on resource consumption and increase page performance. Take the Code Highlighter stylesheet for example: .highlight,pre.highlight{background:#000;color:#abb2bf}.highlight pre{background:#000}.highlight .ge{font-style:italic}.highlight .gs{font-weight:700}.highlight .ow{font-weight:700}.highlight .n,.highlight .nf,.highlight .nn,.highlight .o,.highlight .p{color:#abb2bf}.highlight .c,.highlight .c1,.highlight .cm,.highlight .cp,.highlight .cs{color:#5c6370;font-style:italic}.highlight .sr,.highlight .ss{color:#56b6c2}.highlight .k,.highlight .kc,.highlight .kd,.highlight .kn,.highlight .kp,.highlight .kr,.highlight .kt{color:#c678dd}.highlight .l,.highlight .ld,.highlight .s,.highlight .s1,.highlight .s2,.highlight .sb,.highlight .sc,.highlight .sd,.highlight .se,.highlight .sh,.highlight .si,.highlight .sx{color:#98c379}.highlight .nt,.highlight .nx,.highlight .vi{color:#e06c75}.highlight .il,.highlight .m,.highlight .mf,.highlight .mh,.highlight .mi,.highlight .
item.content:encoded: After Dark makes JIT requests for some external assets to cut down on resource consumption and increase page performance. Take the Code Highlighter stylesheet for example: .highlight,pre.highlight{background:#000;color:#abb2bf}.highlight pre{background:#000}.highlight .ge{font-style:italic}.highlight .gs{font-weight:700}.highlight .ow{font-weight:700}.highlight .n,.highlight .nf,.highlight .nn,.highlight .o,.highlight .p{color:#abb2bf}.highlight .c,.highlight .c1,.highlight .cm,.highlight .cp,.highlight .cs{color:#5c6370;font-style:italic}.highlight .sr,.highlight .ss{color:#56b6c2}.highlight .k,.highlight .kc,.highlight .kd,.highlight .kn,.highlight .kp,.highlight .kr,.highlight .kt{color:#c678dd}.highlight .l,.highlight .ld,.highlight .s,.highlight .s1,.highlight .s2,.highlight .sb,.highlight .sc,.highlight .sd,.highlight .se,.highlight .sh,.highlight .si,.highlight .sx{color:#98c379}.highlight .nt,.highlight .nx,.highlight .vi{color:#e06c75}.highlight .il,.highlight .m,.highlight .mf,.highlight .mh,.highlight .mi,.highlight .mo,.highlight .na{color:#d19a66}.highlight .bp,.highlight .nb,.highlight .nc,.highlight .nd,.highlight .ne,.highlight .ni,.highlight .nl,.highlight .no,.highlight .nv,.highlight .py,.highlight .vc,.highlight .vg{color:#e5c07b}.highlight .err{color:#fff;background-color:#e05252}.highlight .gd{color:#e05252}.highlight .gi{color:#43d08a}.highlight .w{color:#f8f8f2}.highlight .cpf{color:navy}.highlight .gu{color:#75715e}.highlight .lineno{color:#636d83;user-select:none}.highlight .ln{color:#636d83;user-select:none}.highlight .ln:after{content:&#34; &#34;}.highlight .hll{color:#abb2bf;background-color:#3a3f4b}.highlight .hl{color:#abb2bf;background-color:#3a3f4b}.highlight .language-json .w+.s2{color:#e06c75}.highlight .language-json .kc{color:#56b6c2} The stylesheet code shown above is itself highlighted using a JIT request. Confirm by viewing the network requests for this page and observe the fetch request for the syntax.css file as depicted here: jit-requests (document) ├── lazysizes.min.js (fetch) ├── syntax.css (fetch) Using Fetch Injection a JIT request is issued to begin downloading the highlighter stylesheet on-the-fly in parallel with other resources and the base layout takes care to ensure the CSS is only requested on pages that need it. Create your own JIT requests using Custom Layout and Fetch Injection.

item.title: Last Modified
item.description: Denote posts with substantive changes or simply draw older, more relevant posts closer to the top of the listings with last modified. Modifications will be made obvious to visitors with a visible callout in post summaries and the original publish date will be kept intact in the Post Bylines. For robots, making this change will automatically update Schema Structured Data, RSS feeds and the lastmod setting in your Sitemap. Adjust last modified by adding a publishdate to post Front Matter and updating the date to the date and time you would like to show for the modification.
item.content:encoded: Denote posts with substantive changes or simply draw older, more relevant posts closer to the top of the listings with last modified. Modifications will be made obvious to visitors with a visible callout in post summaries and the original publish date will be kept intact in the Post Bylines. For robots, making this change will automatically update Schema Structured Data, RSS feeds and the lastmod setting in your Sitemap. Adjust last modified by adding a publishdate to post Front Matter and updating the date to the date and time you would like to show for the modification. You can be specific and use a datetime (with timezone offset) like: date = &#34;2017-02-02T01:20:56-06:00&#34; publishdate = &#34;2016-11-21T10:32:33+08:00&#34; Or less specific and use just the dates: date = &#34;2017-02-02&#34; publishdate = &#34;2016-11-21&#34; It&rsquo;s also possible to set future and expiry dates for content in Hugo. To learn more see the documentation on Draft, Future, and Expired Content.

item.title: Lazy Loading
item.description: After Dark uses lazySizes to prioritize loading of certain external resources to improve page load times and help reduce overall bandwidth consumption. Lazy loading works automatically for Custom Homepage thumbnails, Post Images and when using the Figure Shortcode, or related Snippet, as seen here: Be Creative AK¥N Cakiner To use lazy loading in Custom Layouts or when creating your own Shortcodes adding the lazyload class and relevant data attributes as shown here:
item.content:encoded: After Dark uses lazySizes to prioritize loading of certain external resources to improve page load times and help reduce overall bandwidth consumption. Lazy loading works automatically for Custom Homepage thumbnails, Post Images and when using the Figure Shortcode, or related Snippet, as seen here: Be Creative AK¥N Cakiner To use lazy loading in Custom Layouts or when creating your own Shortcodes adding the lazyload class and relevant data attributes as shown here: &lt;!-- non-responsive --&gt; &lt;img data-src=&#34;image.jpg&#34; class=&#34;lazyload&#34;&gt; &lt;!-- responsive with automatic sizes calculation --&gt; &lt;img data-sizes=&#34;auto&#34; data-src=&#34;image2.jpg&#34; data-srcset=&#34;image1.jpg 300w, image2.jpg 600w, image3.jpg 900w&#34; class=&#34;lazyload&#34;&gt; &lt;!-- iframe example --&gt; &lt;iframe frameborder=&#34;0&#34; class=&#34;lazyload&#34; allowfullscreen data-src=&#34;//www.youtube.com/embed/ZfV-aYdU4uE&#34;&gt; &lt;/iframe&gt; See lazySizes for additional information and examples.

item.title: Post Bylines
item.description: After Dark creates rich post bylines automatically. Bylines include optional author name, word count, links to Taxonomy Pages and Structured Data. Example Byline Published [by `author`] [`publishdate` or `date`] in [navigation](/categories/navigation) and tagged [links](/tags/links) and [taxonomy](/tags/taxonomy) using [`wordcount`] words. If author is specified in Site Configuration params or post Front Matter it will be included automatically in the byline attributing the author: [params] author = "Billy Joe Jim Bob" # the guy behind the guy behind the guy Adjust hide_author in Site Configuration to suppress attribution site-wide:
item.content:encoded: After Dark creates rich post bylines automatically. Bylines include optional author name, word count, links to Taxonomy Pages and Structured Data. Example Byline Published [by `author`] [`publishdate` or `date`] in [navigation](/categories/navigation) and tagged [links](/tags/links) and [taxonomy](/tags/taxonomy) using [`wordcount`] words. If author is specified in Site Configuration params or post Front Matter it will be included automatically in the byline attributing the author: [params] author = &#34;Billy Joe Jim Bob&#34; # the guy behind the guy behind the guy Adjust hide_author in Site Configuration to suppress attribution site-wide: [params] author = &#34;&#34; # optional setting, not required in config hide_author = true # hides author name and related structured data Combine with categories and Last Modified to produce unique Structured Data.

item.title: Post Images
item.description: Sample image placement. Not the real deal. Add visual appeal to your posts with post images. Post images appear above post content and leverage Hugo Image Processing and Lazy Loading to provide fully automatic, lazy-loaded responsive images with LQIP and built-in art direction. Using post images requires some opinion with regard to the structure of your content. To create a post with a post image you must:
item.content:encoded: Sample image placement. Not the real deal. Add visual appeal to your posts with post images. Post images appear above post content and leverage Hugo Image Processing and Lazy Loading to provide fully automatic, lazy-loaded responsive images with LQIP and built-in art direction. Using post images requires some opinion with regard to the structure of your content. To create a post with a post image you must: Group image and content in a Page Bundle as shown below. Update post Front Matter as described below. An example page bundle might look like: ├── archetypes ├── content │ └── post │ └── secure-your-digital-life │ ├── images │ │ └── florian-klauer-119557-unsplash.jpg │ └── index.md ├── layouts With a header image specified in index.md: [[resources]] src = &#34;images/*119557*&#34; name = &#34;header&#34; Tip: Orientation is not significant. For optimal display use larger images. Add an image caption showing the image title: [[resources]] src = &#34;**291607-unsplash.jpg&#34; name = &#34;header&#34; title = &#34;Ottawa road in the evening&#34; # adds image caption Add Structured Data using Resources Metadata to improve accessibility: [[resources]] src = &#34;**291607-unsplash.jpg&#34; name = &#34;header&#34; title = &#34;Ottawa road in the evening&#34; [resources.params.meta] description = &#34;Light trails depicting speed&#34; # adds alt text and image meta creator = &#34;Marc-Olivier Jodoin&#34; # updates caption and adds image meta Continue adding metadata to improve accessibility: [[resources]] src = &#34;**291607-unsplash.jpg&#34; name = &#34;header&#34; title = &#34;Ottawa road in the evening&#34; [resources.params.meta] description = &#34;Light trails depicting speed&#34; creator = &#34;Marc-Olivier Jodoin&#34; sameAs = &#34;https://unsplash.com/photos/NqOInJ-ttqM/&#34; # also updates caption license = &#34;https://unsplash.com/license&#34; # attribution not required contentLocation = &#34;Ottawa, Canada&#34; keywords = [&#34;light trail&#34;, &#34;building&#34;, &#34;speed&#34;, &#34;night&#34;] Supported metadata in examples above. Adjust display using Custom Styles.

item.content:encoded: Basic usage: {{&lt; hackcss-textinput &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput type=&#34;password&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput type=&#34;email&#34; placeholder=&#34;Please enter your email…&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput disabled=&#34;true&#34; placeholder=&#34;Disabled&#34; &gt;}} With Label and Help Block in Form with custom validation: {{&lt; hackcss-form &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-label &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-helpblock text=&#34;Enter your Associate Tag:&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput name=&#34;AssociateTag&#34; required=&#34;true&#34; pattern=&#34;^\b\w*\b-20$&#34; placeholder=&#34;associate-20&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-label &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-form &gt;}} Enter your Associate Tag: In Form Group with warning Label and Help Block: {{&lt; hackcss-formgroup state=&#34;warning&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-label for=&#34;key64&#34; text=&#34;64-bit PGP key:&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput spellcheck=&#34;false&#34; type=&#34;text&#34; id=&#34;key64&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-helpblock text=&#34;In this format: BB73 67EE 9A70 A631&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} 64-bit PGP key: In this format: BB73 67EE 9A70 A631 Typed with Label in Form Group targeting Form owner: {{&lt; hackcss-form id=&#34;search&#34; action=&#34;/search&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-label for=&#34;query&#34; text=&#34;Search query:&#34; /&gt;}} {{&lt; hackcss-textinput type=&#34;search&#34; id=&#34;query&#34; form=&#34;search&#34; &gt;}} {{&lt; /hackcss-formgroup &gt;}} Search query:

item.title: Video
item.description: Basic usage: {{< video autoplay="true" loop="true" src="assets/sample.mp4" >}} Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video. Download video instead. Assumes the following directory structure: ├── assets ├── content │ └── videos │ └── gifs │ ├── assets │ │ └── sample.mp4 │ └── index.md ├── content With controls: {{< video controls="true" src="assets/sample.mp4" >}} Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video. Download video instead. Absolute src and poster URLs also possible.
item.content:encoded: Basic usage: {{&lt; video autoplay=&#34;true&#34; loop=&#34;true&#34; src=&#34;assets/sample.mp4&#34; &gt;}} Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video. Download video instead. Assumes the following directory structure: ├── assets ├── content │ └── videos │ └── gifs │ ├── assets │ │ └── sample.mp4 │ └── index.md ├── content With controls: {{&lt; video controls=&#34;true&#34; src=&#34;assets/sample.mp4&#34; &gt;}} Your browser doesn't support HTML5 video. Download video instead. Absolute src and poster URLs also possible. Absolute URLs must include a scheme such as http or https. Root-relative URLs not currently possible.
